medical_history.chief_complaint: Shortness of breath, fever, and cough productive of yellow sputum.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began soon after the birth of her third child, resolved after antibiotics for a respiratory tract infection, but recurred as an intermittent nonproductive cough, wheezing, and shortness of breath, with nocturnal worsening.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Active medical problems include depression and seasonal allergic rhinitis; no history of aspirin intolerance or recurrent sinusitis.
medical_history.social_history: Smoked cigarettes for approximately 10 years and quit 10 years prior to presentation; not employed and lives at home with three children and two golden retrievers.
